title: Awesomely Addictive!
comment: Creative gameplay is extremely addictive and makes you think. The great music and simple graphics draw you in and keep you hooked.

title: Excellent
comment: Nice idea and implementation

title: Beautiful
comment: Very simple beautiful game. Love it!

title: Quite Interesting
comment: Its going to take a lot of attempts to figure out all of the stuff available in this seemingly simple game.

title: Didn't like the music
comment: So I'm trying the other, lite, version. This app requires 0 permissions. My thanks to the developer for that.
Amazing rogue variant. The crazy interface is just brilliant. I would just change the music for a more minimalistic approach

title: Interesting take on an old genre
comment: The game is played on a hexagonal grid on a sphere of sorts. The only motivation to play is to gather treasures in each land, so the gameplay becomes rather repetitive quickly. The combat in this game is unusual -- all attacks are one hit kills, so movement and placement of your character becomes tantamount to moving chess pieces. UI is very poor (modal, unreasonable scrolling limits, etc), and the controls need more tweaking. Overall, interesting for a short while, but ultimately uninstallable.

Thanks for the review! Try the last quest, it is of a bit different nature. What do you mean by unreasonable scrolling limits? The hyperbolic geometry of the world makes it almost useless to scroll anyway. INFO/HELP modes are useful to learn about stuff, but after you learn everything, MOVE is probably the only mode you use. Any suggested tweaks?

title: The best Android game
comment: A true Rouge in spirit, while completely innovative and perfect for a smartphone.

title: Well...
comment: I could see some rough potential here, but it has really poor UX and obvious programmer art.  The latter doesn't bother me much, but the poor UX and UI makes the game virtually unplayable.  Needs the touch of a designer.

title: Suprising
comment: I had low expectations for this game but it is surprisingly pretty good

title: Very interesting
comment: Disorienting, to say the least. More of a strategy than an rpg. Fun and worth playing.

title: Nice but...
comment: Entering a wormhole when going for the orbs (after you have 10 each of the treasures) triggers a crash on my S4.  It is hard to win the game when it keeps crashing on me in the final stretch.
Sorry about that. By wormhole, do you mean an Orb of Safety, and did you appear on a great wall? If so, then this should be fixed in 4.4a. Thanks for a report!

title: Wierd little game.
comment: Wierd game. Great for free and good that it does not need any special permissions. No micro transactions either so the developer gets a thumbs up from me.

title: Interesting game
comment: Not my cup of tea but worth trying for the price of FREE!

title: Awesome concept taken nowhere.
comment: This game seemed really interesting to me but it had no staying power. The things you collect have no use, there's no plot or goal aside from kill stuff & collect riches. Also no sound, come on it's 2014! Take this game to where it could be by fleshing it out!
Thanks for the review! There are collectable things which do have uses, and there is the main quest, and you need something different to achieve it. HyperRogue 4.4 includes music.

title: I've never seen anything like it
comment: I've never seen anything like it

title: Good fun
comment: Not very RPG-like, but the difference in geometry makes it worth playing.

title: Minimalistic but good
comment: Nice time waster for a good price ;)

title: Surprisingly fun
comment: I wasn't sure based on the graphics, but I am glad I tried it. Once I got the hang of it, it was fun. It can be a little disorienting, so don't walk away from anything you want :)

title: Cool idea
comment: Its a different way to play a game of cat and mouse

title: Much better!
comment: This update increased my FPS from 5 to 37-45. Wow. Its playable now! (Nexus 7 2013 WiFi)
Good so far

title: Great game, even better dev
comment: Love the game and EVERY mechanic. All the orbs and the enemies have neat abilities. If you find a buy or problem don't hesitate to let the dev know. I got a quick reply as well as thought out responses to my concerns, followed by pretty prompt fixes. Must have got Android

Thanks for a review! The Jungle should be easier (and fixed) in 4.1a. Having a vine chasing you to Hell could be a good thing :) (I mean, I think you could use it for your own purposes... although there are more convenient solutions)

title: Very good game.
comment: Pleasantly surprised by this one. No extra permissions required and it is a fine game. My only gripe is that the game messages flash off the screen far too quickly to be read. This is not a big problem but reduces some of the flavour of the game. Any chance they can be showed down a bit?
Thanks! Messages have been slowed down in Version 4.2.

title: Excellent and challenging
comment: Runs great, looks great, and simple controls

title: An interesting rogue-like
comment: Interesting concept for sure... And cool to try. Graphics could use a little work, and the outlined text is horrible. Still, it has potential.

Thanks for a review! Graphics are hard to do, as the usual approaches do not work in the hyperbolic world. Still, I like the graphics, even though M. C. Escher's "Circle limit" shows how much better they could be. I do not understand, what is the problem with text?

title: Different, but awesome
comment: Good game, no permissions..

title: Awesome game,.love it !
comment: I only really wish that the quest saved. Doing the first area all the time for it sucks  :-P. My favorite area is the mirage desert it is amazing.  When to many dormant plants are nearby you can never kill the root as between all of them you cant move foward. Try putting a territory for each plant or two perhaps where the other plants can't enter  :-)

Thanks for a review! As usual in roguelikes, the quest is not saved (the game is more challenging that way, you need to master everything to win). You do not have to kill all the plants in the Jungle, estimate whether you can go somewhere safely, and if not, choose some other direction. (If there is often no good direction, then this is a bug.)

title: Good
comment: Its a good fun game but not something you play all day

title: Good game
comment: Needs some tweaks, but I love the mechanics overall. This game has a potential.

title: Pretty concept
comment: Puzzle roguelike, don't get trapped.

title: Good
comment: Pretty odd game but thats what makes it unique. Its safe to say ive never played anything like this, but very creative concept, needs a save feature though

title: Great game.
comment: Pretty hard, but really good.

title: Unique
comment: It is something so very interesting and unique. Although panning is extremely sensitive and the game is slowish overall.   Also as a roguelike, it needs more stories etc, more 'feel'

title: Neat idea
comment: But needs gameplay.

title: Interesting idea
comment: Guys, you need artist. And game designer. And where is music?

Thanks for the review! The desktop version has music now. I am not sure whether to add music to the Android version -- I would have to either include it with the app (which I do not like since the app is so small right now), or to download it on request (which would require a permission), or to have a separate version with music.

title: Pretty good
comment: This game would be better if there was a save, I have to constantly play to get anywhere. This is not really a rouge like so the title hyper rouge is not so accurate more like a puzzle dungeon crawler.

title: Not roguelike.
comment: It's more of a puzzle game. Now you're warned.
Not fun
Confusing and needs more...
small size apps are the best!

title: Good
comment: It makes me dizzy though.

title: Interesting Idea...
comment: But poorly executed. Needs levels, items, skills etc.

title: Humz....what do I think?
comment: This game isnt the greatest.  Like its alright and pretty easy to catch on to but its downright boring.  The world looks cool, the view and the way you move are pretty cool. Theres just so little to do.  Like you run around grabbing little stars and tricking monsters into moving within one hex of you so you can click and destroy them.  Um if there was a combat system and you could get items it would be pretty darned sweet.  As it is I wouldnt call it a roguelike...Its more like a puzzler.  Not that a puzzler is so horrible, I just was expecting more.  Thanks

title: Good
comment: No silly permissions required. Game hurts head as advertised.

title: Excellent
comment: Very mathy and interesting. Good game, too.

title: Weird. Good?
comment: I really like this, even if it's very confusing and super weird. The game play seems to lack depth (for a roguelike) and the controls could probably be better, but it's definitely worth a shot if you have an interest in the genre.

title: Just what I was looking for
comment: Simple, fun, retro, randomly generated!
The most creative take on a roguelike I've ever seen

title: Awesome!
comment: HyperRogue belongs on the front page of the Store. I can't stop playing this game, even though it makes my head spin a little bit. :)

title: Lags on nexus
comment: Played it and it looks promising but on nexus I have 2 fps which can't be right, hope this gets fixed soon

title: Different feel.
comment: I love how easy to pick up and play. As a fan of rogue likes, I love how unique this game is.

title: It needs more.
comment: The style is great and the concept is fun but there's just not enough to it. I felt like all I was doing was walking around. With a little work this game has a lot of potential.

title: Great roguelike
comment: Great looking with simple, yet tactical gameplay. The first roguelike that i find playable on my android and its also opensource. Good job on this 7DRL - you should create a donate version :-)

title: Very strange, but compelling
comment: Awesome. Make a Profile system with achievments and such? Runs great on my Moto Droid Razr
